intro: Microcorys tenuifolia, commonly known as the slender-leaf microcorys, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and sometimes endangered species.
